channel.title: Behaviour on IRC
channel.description:
Well as of today, we've had 4 special guests in our IRC channels - Nalioth, Jenda, Quux, and Sportychick. Some of you mightn't know this, but they're freenode staff, and freenode staff don't join small channels for no reason. Especially four separate staff members all joining ours at one time or another.
The reason they have been in #mopar and #moparscape lately is because of the incredibly stupid behavior that users from this community are displaying. DCC exploits, spamming large public channels, and I'm sure that it doesn't stop there. Both Quux and Jenda have, quite clearly, expressed that the behavior is unacceptable - the obvious implication they're making is that if it persists, the channels will be closed down.
To put it clearly, don't ruin it for everyone else - because that's what a select few of you are doing. Freenode is a great network - there are channels for all of the large Linux OS', channels for programming languages, and the obvious advantage of being on a network with these channels is that you can go there for help, as well as seeking help on the forums and in our own channels.
For anyone that still thinks DCC exploits are cool, they're not. Exploits found on google etc are the tools of a script kiddy. So if you think anyone with real computer knowledge thinks you're great because you can do stuff like that, then you should really reconsider - because they don't.

item.title: Behaviour on IRC
item.dc:creator: @god_of_ikiliki god of ikiliki
item.description:
@god_of_ikiliki wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:45, topic:79237”][quote author=God of Ikiliki link=topic=116475.msg1154453#msg1154453 date=1176574377]

From now on, anyone caught in #mopar or #moparscape causing any problems for the rest of freenode, or anyone laughing or joking about the problems caused will be permanently IP banned from the IRC channels AND from the forums. If you think I am joking, go ahead, make my day.

I will trust lothy and others to report this kind of behavior to me, and I will take action against it.

Im at the others right?
[/quote]are you a person that is not lothy?[/quote]
Im not lothy and im not someone else.
Im an alien
Well I mean, the ppl who did it could be the ‘Others’ also so I just ask lol
Maybe he doesnt trust me

Read full topic

item.title: Behaviour on IRC
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“gikid, post:1, topic:79434”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=116475.msg1149568#msg1149568 date=1176500126]
From now on, anyone caught in #mopar or #moparscape causing any problems for the rest of freenode, or anyone laughing or joking about the problems caused will be permanently IP banned from the IRC channels AND from the forums. If you think I am joking, go ahead, make my day.

I will trust lothy and others to report this kind of behavior to me, and I will take action against it.
[/quote]

mopar no offense but your falling into lothy’s trap. he’s a suckup. and lothy stop using my words i don’t like people who do that. but the fact that a staffer had to come to our fourms is saying something. so next time you want to torment an irc channel take it to irc.sythe.org (channel #sythe btw) or some other network.

PS: quux we like it when you guys come to #mopar and #moparscape

hmm lets see how long it takes for this to get deleted…[/quote]
It’s nice to see that you look at me in that light. I simply made a topic because two of the staff have spoken to me so far regarding the channels, in private. I’m guessing you’re not happy, simply because I had to ban your friend RXVL for doing silly things. If you or him don’t like that, then next time follow the rules. That’s all you have to do.

[quote=“Stork, post:30, topic:79237”]Freenode is an information server filled with knowledgeable folks.
#mopar is a place for morons to piss about.

I don’t understand why the decision was made to move the channel to freenode.[/quote]
There are people from this community that visit other channels for help. There are a lot of people on the network who are far ahead of people here in terms of programming skills, or knowledge in something, and a lot of them are willing to help a passer by. I don’t see why we should miss out on that advantage by going elsewhere, if we can manage to stay on freenode.

Read full topic

item.title: Behaviour on IRC
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

_doyley:

its not the server its the retards that dont update there firmware theres no patch for idiots.

All Netgear WGT624 & some other model of Netgear routers are affected (some Linksys are affected too). Only the v3 WGT624 has a recent firmware (ie, after the exploit)
Latest v1 & v2 firmware: http://kbserver.netgear.com/release_notes/d102763.asp - Oct. 18, 2005. Luckily I have a v3

Read full topic

item.title: Behaviour on IRC
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:23, topic:79237”][quote author=ada link=topic=116475.msg1149889#msg1149889 date=1176504801]

Yea, well Javac, they’re providing a free service, which we should be grateful for.

And yea, I’ve witnessed people discussing their “shenanigans” finding it funny, but really, grow up or sumfink.

How do you actually sign up for an IRC channel anyway?
[/quote]

Well there is a sticky here, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,86.0.html

In short, you can download an IRC client such as mIRC(http://mirc.com/get.html) and then you can join the server by typing: /server irc.moparisthebest.com which will bounce you to freenode. Then, do: /join #mopar (and if you want, #moparscape)
You can change your nickname by doing /nick yourname. And to register it you should read: http://freenode.net/faq.shtml#nicksetup but quickly you can just do /ns register yourpasswordhere. And then to log into your account, you do /ns identify yourpasswordhere[/quote]

Sorry, I meant actually “creating” one…

Read full topic

item.title: Behaviour on IRC
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“ada, post:21, topic:79237”][quote author=KryptoN_ link=topic=116475.msg1148316#msg1148316 date=1176478023]
Yea, well Javac, they’re providing a free service, which we should be grateful for.

And yea, I’ve witnessed people discussing their “shenanigans” finding it funny, but really, grow up or sumfink.
[/quote]

How do you actually sign up for an IRC channel anyway?[/quote]

Well there is a sticky here, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,86.0.html

In short, you can download an IRC client such as mIRC(http://mirc.com/get.html) and then you can join the server by typing: /server irc.moparisthebest.com which will bounce you to freenode. Then, do: /join #mopar (and if you want, #moparscape)
You can change your nickname by doing /nick yourname. And to register it you should read: http://freenode.net/faq.shtml#nicksetup but quickly you can just do /ns register yourpasswordhere. And then to log into your account, you do /ns identify yourpasswordhere

Read full topic
